title: Biden Plans New Limits on Arctic Drilling Ahead of Controversial Willow Decision
description: New rules will limit offshore oil leases, among other things, an administration official said. The changes come as the administration moves toward approving an $8 billion ConocoPhillips drilling project.

title: Your Monday Briefing: China’s Saudi-Iran Deal
description: Also, Xi Jinping loyalists stack China’s leadership and Australia revives an Aboriginal alcohol ban.

title: Spiraling Spat With Star Sports Host Puts BBC’s Reputation on the Line
description: The British public broadcaster’s suspension of one of its highest-profile anchors has become a sprawling conflict that poses risks to its reputation for neutrality and independence.

title: War in Ukraine Puts Centuries of Swiss Neutrality to the Test
description: The Alpine state makes arms that Western allies want to send to Kyiv. Swiss law bans this, driving a national debate about whether its concept of neutrality should change.

title: Authorities Reinstate Alcohol Ban for Aboriginal Australians
description: The reaction to a rise in crime has renewed hard questions about race and control, and about the open wounds of discrimination.

title: The First Book of Spring
description: A book can be an accomplice in a coup against winter.

title: Ukraine Steps Up Calls for Evacuation of Northeast Town Under Relentless Russian Shelling
description: Attacks on the town of Kupiansk in Ukraine’s northeastern region of Kharkiv continued on Sunday.

title: Restoring Glory of Angola’s Carnival, With a Puny Budget but Much Passion
description: A singer and son of a music legend is trying to once again make the Carnival celebration a highlight of the year — and to make it a year-round force for positive change in Angola.

title: How the Saudi-Iran Pact Could Transform the Middle East
description: Both countries as well as the broader region have much to gain from the reset in relations — if the agreement truly holds.

title: With Fingerprints, DNA and Photos, Turkey Seeks Families of the Missing
description: More than a thousand earthquake victims are still unaccounted for. Some families waited for days by ruined buildings, hoping to see bodies that never surfaced.
